title: Yousaf Raza Gillani
summary: Syed Yousaf Raza Gillani,[2] also spelled Gilani (Urdu: یوسف رضا گیلانی; pronounced [ˈjuːsʊf rəˈzaː ɡɪˈlaːniː] born 9 July 1952), is a Pakistani politician who served as 18th prime minister of Pakistan from 25 March 2008 until his retroactive disqualification and ouster by the Supreme Court of Pakistan on 26 April 2012. He currently serves as the vice-chairman of the central executive committee of the Pakistan Peoples Party.[3][4][5][6] and in 2021 was elected as a Senator.[7] On 26 March 2021, He was appointed as Leader of Opposition in Senate of Pakistan.
